channel.title: PS3 VS Xbox 360
channel.description:
Xbox 360: PROS: huge online community, great exclusives, Comes with headset, cheaper games, Cons: Reliability, No Blu-ray OR HD-DVD (for those of you who didnt know HD-DVD IS DEAD!!!) You have to pay just to be online, Controller have to replace batteries, No BUILT-IN WI-FI.
PS3: PROS: Blu-ray, More powerful, better made, hardware, internet browser, Slot loading drive Better reliablity, Free online Cons:less exclusive titles, No reverse compatibility,

item.title: PS3 VS Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
Bloodshot:

I had both but i sold my xbox because i could care less about the exclusives on it, and i really never bothered to use it.

Come to think of it, i should sell my ps3 too, but then i wouldn’t be able to watch James Cameron movies on blu-ray (not avatar). My ps3 was basically only used for MGS4 for me, and my (now gone) xbox was used to play halo 2 & 3 because i never got the PC version of halo 2, and obviously halo 3 is only on xbox. I beat halo 2, and got bored of halo 3 after a little while of playing. I obviously didn’t care for them that much, or i would still have my xbox now.

Sell it and buy a Wii. Noa!

Read full topic

Xbox is a dumbed down PC that can’t do anything other then play games.

SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Did you read my post I said the xbox can’t do anything other than games based on that statement one could assume I meant the PS3 does more.

Oh, for God’s sake… I bet my brother’s been on my bleeding account again. He’s a little bastard, I tell you.

item.title: PS3 VS Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
DanielL5583:

Uh, wrong. The PS3 does A LOT more than what the Xbox does.

Can you watch TV shows on the BBC iPlayer without a subscription? One up to Sony.
Can you watch high definitions movies using Blu-Ray technology? Two-nil.

The Xbox is a mere shadow compared to the PS3.

Did you read my post I said the xbox can’t do anything other than games based on that statement one could assume I meant the PS3 does more.

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 VS Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: dankonen
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

If it had a lot of potential, why did it fail? Compared to Blu-Ray, it ain’t got shit. 30 gb max.

Newfags should not be allowed to have an opinion.
Stop fucking bumping this shit.

That’s weird. I guess I am a newfag. Though I believe that people who never post more than 3 lines in a single post shouldn’t have an opinion. You only lash out at people and you seem to have a neck for bashing people on this forum. Why?

Back to topic.

Deadalus193 I think you have the right idea. The fact of the matter is that people prefer certain systems. I prefer PS3 even though I have an XBOX360. Most games nowadays are available on all platforms. But those few games that do come on the market as either an xbox exclusive or PS3 exclusives are the reason for all this bickering. Plus the social networking that goes on between the individual systems.

Since I’m still a lowly IT student and not an experienced programmer or anything my preference goes out to PS3 because it’s simply more economical. The system comes with everything that fits my needs. WiFi, keyboard possibilities and a gigantic hard-drive plus the blu-ray disc driver that supports movies and the brilliance of DTS support. Xbox does not have those things. I’m not saying that xbox is bad, I’m just saying that every customer has his or her own needs.

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 VS Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: Chrillen
item.description:
dankonen:

HD-DVD has the potential to hold 1,5 TB. So this is totally untrue. Blu-ray only won in the market because they were the first ones to win the rights on movies. Same thing happened with the analogue tapes in the 80’s I think. HD-DVD had the real potential but Blu-ray beat them to the finish line by cheating.

It’s a fucking disc storage format, stop being so butthurt.

item.title: PS3 VS Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: dankonen
item.description:
balrock043:

yeah… thats me… haha

blu-ray disks hold a lot more information on the disks, up to 50GB on the single layer, and 100GB on the dual

hd-dvd’s only hold up to 15GB on the single layer, and up to 30GB on the dual layer.

b

HD-DVD has the potential to hold 1,5 TB. So this is totally untrue. Blu-ray only won in the market because they were the first ones to win the rights on movies. Same thing happened with the analogue tapes in the 80’s I think. HD-DVD had the real potential but Blu-ray beat them to the finish line by cheating.

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 VS Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: dankonen
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

But why, I keep my xbox in my drawer. it works more efficiently that way.

But srsly, yeah, I’ve opened my xbox before, besides the horrible metal enclosure (similar material and feel of glazed steel lampposts very rough) the heat sink is al-right, but it has no fan on it (both GPU and CPU), the only fans in the case at the rear expel air there, if the heat sink design was changed, and you added a fan or 4? maybe some 40mills or something, you probably wouldn’t get any heating issues.

Exactly! I’d love to do that but I’d like to keep my warranty and I don’t like to spend a lot of money on a click on system.

The downer about 360 is that as soon as you buy one you might as well put up a gigantic sign on your back with a gigantic arrow pointing down with the words “Right there Microsoft” because that’s what’s going to happen whether you want to or not.

Once I bought my XBOX and danced around with it proudly I was screwed. No more space on my hard-drive. €60
Than a friend wanted to play with me but I didn’t have another controller. €45
Than I found out that in order to have HDMI visuals and analogue sound I needed a special Microsoft Xbox 360 Cable ©. €50
After that I was alright for quite a while. Until I moved my xbox 360 to my apartment and needed wireless network. €80
Than I found out you can chat with your xbox360 controller keyboard©. €35
Than I needed a headset for cool streamlined gaming. €45
After all the rocky starts I was finally ready to really play some games. Than I realized that I had already payed €200 in online costs.

So lets recap here. Excluding the XBOX I have payed a total whopping €515,- which I could have used to buy a frigging monster PC which kicks the ass of XBOX any time of the day.

Now for the PS3: I get all that shit for free. Except for the headset. I still need to pay for those. I could’ve saved €315 if I hadn’t bought that frigging Xbox 360.

In short: In the end the PS3 is cheaper, stronger, better looking, cooler and less frustrating. I still kick myself because of it every day.

Read full topic
